column4: Is there a kind of "registry" like in windows in which i can delete entries for a specific application?
a config file or something that i can edit

I'm trying to install Frostwire after mistakenly erased its folders and files in my filesystem, but the software center tells me that the version i'm trying to install is not co-installable with the one that is "installed".
ok i get it let me try it
Then install with sudo apt-get install --force-yes packagename
i get the same error http://pastebin.com/UQMp7FSP
I'm stumped.  Let me see what I can find.
ok thanks! I'm looking for a solution too, that's why i think it might be some sort of config file
What happens if you type "dpkg --remove frostwire"?
dpkg: warning: there's no installed package matching frostwire
Download the .deb manually from the repository for the OLD version you deleted, dpkg -i packagename, and then uninstall it properly

I finally did it!, it happens that the actual name of the old "package" was frostwire:i386 so I just did dpkg --remove as you told me with "frostwire:i386" and it removed it, then i tried to install it from the ppa and it worked! Thanks a lot for your help!
You're welcome!!  Good luck and G-D bless!
